info.description:
# logolas

Analysis and summarization tool for logs and traces of the Elrond Node


## Installation

### Ubuntu

Make sure that you have installed **Python3** (version **3.6** or later) and **Pip3** in advance:

```
python3 --version
pip3 --version
```

Then issue the following command:

```
pip3 install --user --upgrade --no-cache-dir logolas
```

Test installation as follows:

```
pip3 show logolas
logolas --version
```

If `logolas` command is not found (not registered correctly), type this in the current console:

```
source ~/.profile
```

### MacOS

Make sure that you have installed **Python3** (version **3.6** or later) and **Pip3** in advance:

```
python3 --version
pip3 --version
```

Add this line to `~/.bash_profile` or `~/.zshrc` (if you’re using zsh) before installing the package (make sure to replace the placeholders):

```
export PATH=/Users/YOUR_USERNAME/Library/Python/YOUR_PYTHON_VERSION/bin:${PATH}
```

For example:

```
export PATH=/Users/elrond/Library/Python/3.7/bin:${PATH}
```

Then issue the following command:

```
pip3 install --user --upgrade --no-cache-dir logolas
```

Test installation as follows:

```
pip3 show logolas
logolas --version
```

## Command-line interface

Pretty unzip logs arhive:

```
logolas unzip ./logs-archive.zip ./my-workspace
```

Summarize log files in a folder:

```
logolas summarize ./my-workspace
logolas summarize ./my-workspace/Grouped/Shard-metachain
logolas summarize ./my-workspace/Grouped/Shard-1/Node-14
logolas summarize ./my-workspace/Grouped/Shard-1/Node-14 --tag=foo
```
